# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]+" => "_")
end
```
This function works by firstly converting `col` to lower case and then removing any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. It then replaces all spaces and hyphens in the resulting string with underscores, using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[ -]+"` is used to match one or more spaces or hyphens.
